headline: CTO @ Tablevibe | YCombinator (S21)
summary:
I have a diverse background in both retail management and technology. I began my career as a manager at Decathlon, but was captivated by the power of technology and decided to transition to a career in software development. 

I have been working as a freelance developer for several years, providing technical expertise and support to various projects in the tech industry. During this time, I have also managed the Le Wagon coding bootcamp in Bali and covered the lead teacher’s role in the APAC region, where I have had the privilege of coaching and mentoring over 400 alumni from all over the world. 

I'm now CTO at Tablevibe, leading an amazing tech team in developing a platform for direct restaurant sales to customers.

In addition to my professional pursuits, I am a passionate outdoor enthusiast and ultra runner. I have competed in several > 100 miles races with top 3 results. 
I chronicled my 8-month trek through Nepal and India in the book "Volevo Vedere l'Himalaya", sharing my journey with readers.
My love for nature and outdoor activities has been a source of inspiration and motivation throughout my career.

experiences.title: Chief Technology Officer
experiences.description: Tablevibe creates webshop technology for restaurants to take direct pickup and delivery orders from their customers. We partner with top tier delivery partners to deliver the orders. Restaurants save 50-70% of costs compared to orders coming in through delivery apps and they finally get insight into who their delivery customers are so they can build their customer database and reengage their customers.

experiences.title: Teacher and Bootcamp Manager
experiences.description:
Teaching students how to build awesome products in Bali at Le Wagon intensive full stack developer coding bootcamp.
Introducing them to developer's tools & workflow, basic and advanced programming concepts in Ruby, Software Architecture (OOP), Relational Database, SQL & ORM, Frontend Development, ES6 and Ruby on Rails to build and deploy their own web apps.

Stack: Ruby, RubyOnRails, JavaScript (Vanilla, JQuery, Ajax), PostGreSQL, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, GitHub & Heroku
Soft skills: Design (Sketch/Figma), Software Engineering, Web Project Development

experiences.title: Store Operation Manager and Personnel administration Manager
experiences.description:
- Made decisions necessary to develop business performance and to optimize profitability
- Reviewed and simplified operations and sales processes to better serve customers and the team 
- Ensured customer satisfaction by managing store maintenance, image, sales and promotions. 
- Handled employee relations, payroll, benefits and training 
- Coordinated store targets and sales strategies 
- Developed HR strategy, overseeing immediate and long term staff requirements 
- Responsible for recruiting, screening, interviewing, placing and training employees. 
- Directed employee development, ensuring consistent training and career advancement

experiences.title: Sales department manager
experiences.description:
- Executed weekly performance analysis and created action plans to maximize sales. 
- Carried out department piloting and implemented local communication plans 
- Managed point of sale and stock monitoring 
- Guaranteed the safety of goods, employees and customers

experiences.title: Sales specialist
experiences.description:
- Carried out tax inventories
- Managed products within the store 
- Organized sporting events

education.activities_and_societies:
Attended Le Wagon Bali (Batch # 128).
9-week intensive coding bootcamp learning HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript ES2015, SQL, git, GitHub, Heroku and Ruby on Rails. Designed, Implemented and Shipped to production a clone of AirBnB and a Rails prototype of run-db.com

recommendations:
Elijah Johnston

      
          
          



              
                
        
              
  

      
          Guido is a rockstar, and I'd recommend him to anyone looking for a dedicated learner with curiosity and leadership. We worked closely together on the Le Wagon Bali team and he is one of the most enjoyable people I've gotten a chance to work with. Very insightful and understanding, very skilled and knowledgable, and very organised in the way he thinks and manages. I know that anyone who works with Guido will end up making a new friend as well - his character is filled with integrity and empathy, making it easy to connect with him personally. Time and time again, I see how students of the bootcamp respond to Guido and it directly reflects that he is an outstanding human being.
